Review.Titre: Had phone stolen four days ago
Review.Contenu: Had phone stolen four days ago, and have had "chat" with multiple associates in this time period.  Twigby said they sent Port Out Pin # to my email, however, two days later they repaired their email system and I received a # that did not work. Decided to go with Verizon, and have been waiting for Port Out Pin # that works properly.  Twigby has sent three different #'s now and Verizon says Twigby has to Remove the Delay Status.  Some one has to make this right and have some intelligence.  Obsurd business practices

Review.Titre: Bad service and scummy business practices
Review.Contenu: I live in a major metropolitan area with excellent cell reception and this is the only service I've ever had drop out for minutes at a time multiple times. In addition, they don't make it clear that autopay is the only payment option. If you sign up, you're signed up for good. You must contact support and go through a bunch of rigamarole to cancel. I threatened to charge back the payment since it wasn't made clear I was signing up for autopay and they threatened in return to charge me $30 for doing the chargeback. It's true that they have my payment information and could try it, but if they do, I will report them to the BBB and FTC. Companies should not be able to threaten their customers with random charges for doing chargebacks. On top of having scummy business practices, like I said, their service stinks. I'm outta here.

Review.Titre: they canceled my number for no reason
Review.Contenu: they canceled my number for no reason.with only a one time notice.was not willing to help me get my number back to port it out to another provider.i would recommend that if you want to save your number make sure to take your number out today there are some more good companies with the same great prices and better service.i tried to chat but nobody helped me.i sent a few emails no repliesupdate for 10/31/2023 they helped me reactivate so i can port out but if i pay for unlimited really it should be unlimited but i can get my number out.

Review.Titre: I attempted to switch my service to…
Review.Contenu: I attempted to switch my service to your firm and to this date, no one has contacted me with anything but a form email saying your firm needs help. Your firm MUST need help!PostScript this into my review: yes, you sent me automated emails 7 or 8 (I don't care if it's 100) times. What does it communicate to me when I can't receive a PHONE call from a company I'm supposed to be receiving PHONE services from? And as a prospective customer, I'm an afterthought!! What the heck will I be when I have committed to your company? You've got to be kidding.

Review.Titre: BUYER BEWARE
Review.Contenu: Absolutely useless.  They kept bumping me to 2G speeds even though I had 20 gigs of data. I had to contact them 4 times in under 3 weeks to fix it and there are constant issues.  Finally went to them today and they told me they couldn't fix the problem because they were experiencing "carrier issues".  These people clearly don't give the data speed as advertised. Also note: there is no phone number to call, it's all s chat and you can't contact them over a holiday if you desperately need data.  Didn't care enough to fix the problem. Absolutely useless. I went to Red Pocket instead

Review.Titre: Leaving Twigby Soon
Review.Contenu: Twigby sold me a phone that doesn't even last they day.  When I told them the battery health was only 85% they said they could send me a new phone but couldn't guarantee it would be better.  I'll be switching from this company momentarily.Edit:  Their response is that their phones go through rigorous testing, so rigorous in fact that the phone won't even last the day.  That should tell you everything you need to know about their refurbished phones.

Review.Titre: There is no active customer service plus poor incentives
Review.Contenu: There is no active customer service, just written questions posed to no-name, no-faced CSRs. They hide in fine print that the rewards for someone else signing up excludes family members which is hugely counterproductive to building a customer base. All in all, Twigby is too raw and not very well thought out. I am already looking for another provider.

Review.Titre: The service was great until I hit the…
Review.Contenu: The service was great until I hit the 20GB data limit.  The "throttle" on speed was more like an emergency brake.  None of my apps would work properly (on a Galaxy Note9, mind you, not a new phone), including a browser I wanted to use to chat with customer service!  The throttle needs to be less severe.

Review.Titre: I dealt with Twigbys sketch service for…
Review.Contenu: I dealt with Twigbys sketch service for a year. Then,  fed up with growing bills and worsening service I switched service to Verizon who is supposed to somehow be affiliated. They're NOT! Do not be deceived by good reviews or their bogus come ons. As they explain,  they're an "internet based" company.  That means you never deal with a human. Only bots. And if you cancel their service they can still continue to dip into your payment source and take money.  Try making that stop.  The phone numbers provided are only for bots! They direct you to sign in online,  but you can't if you've canceled their service.  And their chat doesn't work because they don't recognize you as a customer.  BUYER BEWARE! DON'T USE TWIGBY!

Review.Titre: Chat with a Human
Review.Contenu: You do not have any place on your site where a person can enter into a chat with a live person to ask questions,Your actual phone service is great, but if one cannot get answers to questions when needed, it matters not how good your service is.

Review.Titre: Lame customer service through chat…
Review.Contenu: Lame customer service through chat only, and then when problem was not fixed, you switched communication to email only!  Took forever to get problem fixed, had to turn it over to Verizon because Twigby is clueless!  Unable to do any out-going calls for weeks!

Review.Titre: Frequent low or no signal in Chicago
Review.Contenu: Frequent low or no signal in Chicago. Deceptive regarding "unlimited" plan as they split it across accounts and it is limited to 20gb (after which drops to 2g). Poor experience compared to other cheapo MVNOs.

Review.Titre: WIFI CALLING UNAVAILABLE ON TWIGBY!!…
Review.Contenu: When I signed up with Twigby I was NOT informed that the service did not support WiFi Calling.  I live in a neighborhood with very poor Verizon reception and I ABSOLUTELY require WiFi Calling on my mobile phone.  I was shocked to learn it was not available and I feel that the absence of this feature should be stated very clearly at the time of sign up for those who require it.  I have had to jump through many hoops to get back my prior service and I would not have this challenge if Twigby had been up front about it.

Review.Titre: I'm not able to call certain phone…
Review.Contenu: I'm not able to call certain phone numbers, including my office. Opened a ticket to investigate but no response yet.  Also, lack of wifi options is a major limitation in my area with poor cell coverage.

Review.Titre: Poor reception in reno and international calling to free countries listed not working
Review.Contenu: poor reception in reno, nv. calls getting disconnected. international calling to india says free but i am unable to connect. overall, google fi and mint was way better than twigby (verizon).

Review.Titre: Poor coverage, dishonest customer service
Review.Contenu: I contacted this company after they responded to my review. Their response was all show. They did absolutely nothing to remedy the situation. See review below.The phone I purchased from this company was advertised as unlocked. I was with Twigby for three months and left due to spotty coverage in the urban area I live in. I tried to activate this phone with Tmobile and was told it was locked to Sprint SIMS only. I now have a worthless phone that I only used for three months. I have filed complaints with the better business bureau and the FCC, but have never received a reply from Twigby. They could care less about their customers.

So I tried to connect with the chat help and they can't assist me because I don't have some 4 digit code.  I don't have a code because I haven't activated account because I need SIM Cards to do so.  So I went to another service that was willing to help me.

Review.Contenu: I have yet to use it the plan.  Waiting on a porting of my landline phone number.  I have not received any correspondence on the matter or offered a new phone number.  Guess they are just collecting money for nothing.  I am not presently living in my house where the landline is, so I have zero phone access.

Review.Titre: We got Twigby because it used Verizon…
Review.Contenu: We got Twigby because it used Verizon towers. As we discovered it doesn't use all Verizon towers and we had no service in our home. When we tried to use wifi calling, we were told that Twigby was not setup for that yet. After about 15 minutes with Twigby we decided to return to our old carrier. When we tried to pinout, we ran into a lot of trouble. First the people in the department we needed were not there after 6 Eastern Standard Time, then they weren't there on weekends.  Then they didn't have the name correct. It ended up taking four days to switch back and we didn't have cell service during that time. You get what you pay for with Twigby.

Review.Titre: I live in the heart of the city and had…
Review.Contenu: I live in the heart of the city and had nothing but connection issues from day one. They did their troubleshoot and it didn't help. They offered again but I have no faith or trust in them. The fees on their promo were ridiculous. It felt more like robbery than a deal. Lastly, what an idiotic name. I had to check my email each time to remember what brand of company I was using.

Review.Titre: I kept getting the run around for…
Review.Contenu: I kept getting the run around for weeks.  Constantly told to chat back. It took 21 days to get my issue fixed and I ended up finding it out not the support.  I found out on Twigbys page the data had been turned off.  If I hadnt found that out then I was being instructed to contact again in another 3 days.

Review.Titre: Not the greatest business practices...
Review.Contenu: Re, Response: I reviewed the time that the order was placed and found it was within 10-15 minutes of the designated timeframe. To, again, offer expedited shipping and to NOT ship on Saturdays and Sundays is utterly ridiculous and highly uncompetitive. This EXACTLY why outsourced business are winning in this country. Shameful. I paid for expedited SIM shipping. They not only waited until Monday to ship it, but they never refunded that amount both after delaying SIM shipping and did not refund that amount after I left. 3 stars removed for that. It ended up taking a week for an expedited SIM shipment to be received, and that is entirely unacceptable. I only have to wait 1-3 days with anyone else. They use VZW, which is a very problematic network in most of the country. They cover my area well but their data network is atrocious, so I couldn't stay. Also, when I signed up, it turns out my area code was out of numbers!! I couldn't find this out until I talked to a rep, and while they were able find and figure this out, I do not understand how getting a number is this difficult, and why it did not show any sort of error on my account (in my case, the process was just halted after activating the SIM and I had no idea what I was waiting for). If I did not contact support right away, I would've been waiting for nothing and not have known why.

Review.Titre: Although we checked the coverage maps…

Review.Contenu: I recieved the phone but when I tried to sign in my password was rejected as well as the new one one I applyed for . A request for help I sent weeks ago has yet to be answered.

Review.Titre: Happy until I needed support
Review.Contenu: TLDR; you can be on the same network, spend about the same amount, get more data, and receive much better customer service from Visible. If you want to be on the Verizon network, Visible is better than Twigby.Twigby had a great deal: $10/month for a 2 GB plan. That promo lasted 6 months, then it turns to $20/mo. I signed up. Within a month, the same priced plan turned into a 3 GB plan, but my plan was still 2 GB. I messaged to see if I could get mine changed. The answer was No, not unless I wanted to give up my $10 promo. I was bummed, but whatever. I still felt like I was getting a good deal.A few months later, I notice Visible has a promo for unlimited data at $15/month (normally $30/mo at that time, but now $25/mo) for 12 months. Twigby is also on the Verizon network. I told Twigby. They said that they couldn't match the deal. I decided to switch to Visible.At this point, I still had a good impression of Twigby. They weren't amazing, but they were cheap. I'll deal with a fair amount of bologna to save money.I tried to cancel my service. They delayed canceling my service until after they charged me for a full month. Legit, we are talking minutes later.I brought it to their attention. They refused to reverse the charge even though I didn't use their service at all that month. I had to file a dispute with my credit card.I couldn't be happier with Visible. I pay $25/month flat (that includes all taxes and stuff). My $20/month plan with Twigby came out to almost $23/month after taxes. For an extra $2 each month, I get unlimited data instead of 2 GB.I haven't tried to cancel with Visible yet. They might pull shady stuff like Twigby, but I doubt it. When I left the country for Japan, I asked them about suspending my service. Visible was like, "Just don't pay your bill." I followed their advice. When I landed in the US, I paid my bill. My service restarted and my new billing date was a month after that. It was really easy.In short, you can be on the same network, spend about the same amount, get more data, and receive much better customer service from Visible. If you want to be on the Verizon network, Visible is the way to go.I hope this review helps. I don't hate Twigby. They just annoyed me.

Review.Titre: Chat bots that lie and tell you they…
Review.Contenu: Chat bots that lie and tell you they are a real person to start.  Then said bots trying to convince you that you are wrong with a download from the internet that was absolutely false.  Regarding esim.  My Motorola razr uses esim.  There is no external sim but had to argue with chat bot.  Finally got help and refunded.

Review.Titre: Reliance on USPS is a deal breaker.
Review.Contenu: Reliance on USPS is a deal breaker.Refusal to refund on a non-delivered phone because your supplier, the USPS, has not returned it to you yet is NOT MY PROBLEM! [[The response from Twigby is factually correct with two exceptions. 1) I did not agree to send my 84yo mother to the post office to deal with the issue, nor did Twigby offer a telephone number. USPS tracking shows that USPS returned the package. The fact that the supplier hired by twigby, USPS, did not perform as the company expected is not my problem.2) USPS is the primary shipper for Twigby AND it is the only option. Expedited USPS is your only choice if you run into a problem, and that resulted in 6 business days or more delivery time in my case, twice, to a good address. That service is supposed to be 3 to 5 business days. Good luck with that.]]Subsequent delivery of non-functional sim, followed by still undelivered replacement (USPS again) is another example of why relying on USPS will kill your company.Customer service has been given a script that they stick to. Unfailingly polite, but offering no way to escalate other than cancel the contract. That's what we did. [[Both sides of this explanation, mine and Twigby customer service, mostly align. My conclusion is that Twigby's reliance on USPS may introduce delays to your experience, and if there are technical issues, can result in extended delays and possibly outage of your service once you do a number transfer. This made the service unacceptable in my case and I am fully responsible for the mistake in selecting the service. The company offers the service they advertised with the exception of handling of a non-deliverable package by their selected supplier. My conclusion is that this level of service involves risks that I failed to appreciate and that others may find themselves in a similar situation if they choose Twigby. ]]

Review.Titre: I canceled at the first of the year Jan…23
Review.Contenu: I canceled at the first of the year Jan 23. It is Mar n they are still billing me. I no I closed the account of mine n my husband's.  They first said last month I needed to pay a month for when I first got Twigby. Now they r saying I never canceled. Going to cut my debit card n get a new one. Sick of dealing with them!!!

Review.Titre: Hard to leave and rude customer service
Review.Contenu: The service while I was with them was fine. Not great, just fine. Everything is virtual, so getting a human if there is an issue is nearly impossible. Also, the cost of went up significantly over time because of fees and upgrades that were added to the account without my knowledge. That said, it was still a little bit cheaper (at the time) than other services.Porting into the Twigby was fine, but porting out has been a nightmare. It requires a person to port your number out to another carrier, which is fine, but those people don't work weekends. It can also take up to 4 days to get it done, I am told, though it says nothing to that effect anywhere on the site. Customer service just kept repeating that they recommend 4 days, like it was all my fault that this was happening to me. Then I asked if they could at least pro-rate my final month of service since I would only be on for 1 day of the new billing cycle while the porting was taking place and they said no. I was going to be billed for an entire month and there was nothing I could do, even though I started the process 3 days before the end of the cycle. The customer service rep I had was rude and unhelpful. I am glad I am leaving this company. Good riddance. My new plan is about half of the cost of Twigby and without all the hassles (at least so far). Save yourself a future headache and go with someone else.

Review.Titre: Twigby service reps online chat & defective BLU phone
Review.Contenu: Just purchased a BLU smartphone with Twigby, 6-11-23.  When I try to do the set up settings, the phone would not let me reboot to recovery settings & the keypad would not show on the screen.  The manual that comes with the phone is VERY INCOMPLETE!  Was on the chat online with several reps WHO STATED THEY R TECH SUPPORT.  None of them could resolve the issues I was having.  After wasting several hours, I ask for another phone since this one has issues, defects, problems.  Jon response was, WE CAN EXCHANGE IT,BUT U WILL BE CHARGED A $15 EXCHANGE FEE!  I informed Jon the following,  I WILL NOT PAY ANY FEES BECAUSE OF POOR PHONE SERVICE, TIME LOST, PHONE ISSUES, PHONE NOT WORKING LIKE ITS SUPPOSE TOO.  I ALSO STATED U WILL BE HEARING FROM MY BANK, FCC & THE ATTORNEY GEN ON THIS MATTER.  I should have received a manual that was complete/should not have to go to website for another incomplete manual , should have received a phone with no issues, like keypad not showing up or phone will not reboot.  Then they wonder why people get upset/mad & write negative comments!                               After writing this review, I have this happen.                     I received this email for $10 off next phone purchase.  Had problems today with your new BLU View 3 phone, with the following; won't reboot, keypad does not show up on screen.   WASTED SEVERAL HRS WITH THE FOLLOWING REPS; Annie, Jon, Harry, & Jon the manager.  NOTHING GOT RESOLVED.  Had problems on your web site to order another BLU View 3 phone since the one Twigby sent me is defective!   I also went to your web site for a more complete manual.  Since the manual with the phone I received IS INCOMPLETE, JUST AS THE WEB SITE MANUAL IS!I've also told your reps I am NOT PAYING FOR ANY FEES, EXCHANGE FEES ETC.  I ALSO REQUESTED MY $10 CODE BE APPLIED TO EITHER MY CREDIT CARD OR MY ACCOUNT, SINCE YOUR REPS WOULD NOT APPLY IT TO MY PURCHASE OF A NEW BLU VIEW 3 PHONE.  ALL I GET FROM YOUR REPS IS EXCUSES & NO RESULTS!I also inform your reps, I will be filing a complaint with the FCC, Attorney General & my bank if I'm charged with any exchanged fees & do not received the $10 off like this email states!

Review.Titre: Avoid this Service
Review.Contenu: Nothing worked correctly. I attempted to transfer my number. I provided all the information in my initial application. Review.Titre: Refused to work with our (major) VPN
Review.Contenu: Twigby offers service in our area so we thought we'd give it a try. We've been with them now for about two years. Neither of us uses a mobile phone to call or receive calls. Nearly all our communication is done via texting apps, email, or IM services like Signal. The few times we were out and about and wanted a map software service working via our mobile data plan, this wouldn't work for us. Twigby couldn't help us. Recently, for the first time in over a year, I tried to use my mobile phone to make a call. It "failed." I remembered Twigby is my provider so I went to the website to see if there's a problem with my plan. Nope. I finally contacted a Twigby support rep who had me go through a series of settings. The problem? We use VPNs on our phones for privacy and to minimize corporate data harvesting. Apparently, this disrupts Twigby. We were asked to disable the VPN to use our mobile plan.We opted to terminate service with Twigby. Our privacy is worth far more to us than a spotty mobile plan, especially when the great bulk of our communication is already through other means. Very suspicious that a telecom company requires the ability to track users beyond what they already do--constantly monitor the IMEI/unique phone identifier. Two stars for pricing. But very disappointed Twigby won't work with our VPN.*******Reply to Twigby's Response********Since we don't use our phones other than in emergencies, we keep Airplane mode on. Whenever we've needed mapping software to guide us to an unfamiliar location, the software--including the OS-native mapping software--has failed. We recently tried to enable wifi-calling (the day I couldn't get Twigby to work). My iPhone threw a message that to enable wifi-calling, I'd have to contact Verizon. So that's not as simple as simply enabling the function in settings.Yes, Verizon has historically been rated highest on US coverage. But Verizon itself has told us that it deprioritizes network connections to its non-Verizon customers such as those using a service that has an agreement with Verizon to use its towers. The brief while we had Verizon in our neighborhood, our connections were flawless. As soon as we switched to Verizon-shared companies, our connection quality and reliability plummeted. And, respectfully, it's still unsatisfactory that to have a reasonably reliable connection to Twigby, we have to disable one of the few tech protections our family has to mitigate un-wanted data collection on our devices.

Review.Titre: Received poor quality "certified" phone
Review.Contenu: *Update: Did finally receive an email from Twigby. Sad that it took a review to get that to happen opposed to replying to the email sent directly to them days prior to the reveiw. The customer service is quite slow in getting a response via email so I am still waiting to see how it ends. I will try to update once it is completely resolved. I ordered a phone from Twigby to begin service with them. The phone I ordered was supposedly a "certified" phone. It was a Samsung S10e. When the phone arrived the back of the phone was not adhered as it should be. I contacted Twgiby customer service and was told to send pictures of my phone to a managerial email. It took several business days to get a response. the response accused me of having tampered with the phone and claiming that is would never have been shipped in the condition I recieved it. "...We can tell from these pictures that someone has tried to remove the backplate from the phone.  We review all of our Certified phones and hold them to the strictest standards; so, the phone would not have left our warehouse in this condition.  " This is wholly untrue. I received the phone in the condition I contacted them about - with the back plate being open. It has been five days from my response to them and I have yet to get a further response from Twigby after informing them that the phone was received in the condition I contacted them about. To make matters worse while I was waiting on replies from Twigby about what there were going to do about the phone, due to the loose back it got dropped and cracked, then dropped again and rendered completely useless. I had not yet purchased a case and cover as I was waiting to see what was going to be done about the phone. The situation is what it is, a little customer service would have gone a long way instead of accusing me of damaging a phone that I recieved from them in damaged condition. Their "certified" phones mean nothing pertainging to the quality you will receive. Extremely dissappointed and will now be looking for a new carrier to move all 3 of our phone numbers over to as we will no longer be using Twigby. Hoping others have had a better experience.

Review.Titre: I had overall negative interactions with many of your CSRs in the same day due to Verizon's service being down in my area for more than 24 hours
Review.Contenu: I had overall negative interactions across multiple messaging experiences with four of your CSRs, two of those occurring with the same CSR. I got so frustrated at the argumentative behavior of all your CSRs except the first, who I would give 5 stars, the rest 2 stars. I had to ask repeatedly about not having service, and suspecting problems with Verizon's network particularly that a person who has Verizon directly was at my home and did not have service and needed to use a VOIP on my laptop to call his wife as my cell (via Twigby) was down also. My cell was down more than 24 hours in all. Those interactions were so challenging because of your CSRs and I messaged in multiple times, and your CSRs, who typically are very responsive and not gaslighting, were just the opposite in the chats I copied, with zero cause coming from me though due to their behavior, I got frustrated to which your CSRs exacerbated their behavior and escalated the gaslighting, and did not de-escalate, all because Verizon's network was down. And I have received zero credit on my account for not being able to use my cell for those more than 24 hours and wasting so much time messaging with your CSRs when the cause of the problem should have been proactively communicated to me and any other Twigby customer so impacted. I am otherwise grateful to have Twigby not offshore their CSRs... thank you for that corporate decision. Mark S. Pirie, PhD6/23/2023: In response to the reply from Twigby-You would think that I would be notified if I received a credit on my account or I could see the amount of the credit if I logged into my account and looked at the billing history; I was not notified and there is no history of a credit that I could find. And this credit came weeks after the event. I had a credit on my account already, and if I subtract that from the current negative balance, I can calculate that $14 something was the amount of the credit, for about three hours of my time that I had to force your CSR to contact Verizon, that he initially refused to do which put your CSR and I on a negative tract from that point forward. Fourteen dollars credit for wasting hours of my time with contentious CSRs who do not see me, who gaslit me, who did not want to help me, who did not inquire about how long I would be without service, and who eventually hung up the chat on me--not a fair exchange, and I hope this is not how your company always treats its customers. The Verizon outage was not Twigby's fault... was it mine? Was Twigby put out by not having cell/text service or me, and did Twigby get CSR responses that were fully inappropriate to the situation or was that me, your customer who did? You have this backwards, sir/madam, I am your customer who was put out and your CSRs and you could not care one bit... typical corporate response. My loss of hours with rude CSRs in exchange for $14 and somehow Twigby is not responsible for their CSR behavior with customers and I should overlook the impact of my being without service for more than 24 hours, because weeks later, you credited me without telling me about your $14 credit. Did you even read the hours of messaging history before you so blithely apologized to me?

Review.Titre: The verdict is still out
Review.Contenu: The verdict is still out.  While I do get good coverage for phone calls, my data plan is messed up.  Upon initial startup with Twigby, they claim that I used 4GB of data in a matter of 10 minutes.  Result is having no access to data for the remainder of my first month with Twigby.  I messaged them about this.  Their response is that they just record what the towers report to them.  I have not ever used data to this degree.  It seems impossible to accrue this much data usage in such a short time.  They did not correct the problem.  We’ll see what happens in month 2 of the introductory period. I’ll wait another month and see how this goes before changing my overall rating.

Review.Titre: The process of figuring out a…
Review.Contenu: The process of figuring out a warranty/return/refund is very confusing. The customer service reps who helped me did a good job. It's just that all of the twigby rules are complex. I am still unsure if it's more worth it to just buy a new phone, rather than go through this process (I've already paid more than I paid for the phone). Plus, who keeps the original box that phones come in?? I can't believe you're going to charge me $5 because I'm returning it without the box.

Review.Titre: There are things you could do to improve service.
Review.Contenu: 1. It takes far too long to get the sim card and have the number ported, there must be a way to expedite the process. If the card goes out the day it is paid for, it should arrive in three days or so, not two weeks or longer.2. It would be important to inform page plus customers that their account number is their IMEI. Page plus will not tell you that, and unless you know that, your number will not be ported. We are still waiting for my son's phone to port, it has been a couple of weeks now.

Review.Titre: Contacted twigby about bad sim card
Review.Contenu: Contacted twigby about bad sim card. Phone unusable with bad sim card. Twigby service/help very good as usual. My only problem was new sim card was sent USPS PRIORITY mail which took 4 days to recieve. Overnight FedEx would have been better since phone was unusable for 4 days.

Review.Titre: Poor agreements. Data sometimes works, other just don't.
Review.Contenu: It's terrible that you have to dial a number for international calls before actually dialing the real number. It's also not working outside the US. No roaming agreements with anyone? Not even Canada or Mexico? And the Service at the Miami airport was less than poor. No data was coming in.

Review.Titre: It is extremely difficult to navigate…
Review.Contenu: It is extremely difficult to navigate thru your sight in trying to enroll in a plan and buy a phone. It was very frustrating and I chatted with two different chat people and neither were very helpful in assisting me. It took me probably 3 hours to get this accomplished

Review.Titre: Poor incoming text photo quality
Review.Contenu: The incoming text message picture quality is awful on this company's most popular phone, the TCL A30. They refuse to look into it, even after contacting support 3 times over chat. Cut-rate prices only get you so far - you have to be willing to fix technology issues in order to be proficient in what you're offering. If you go with Twigby, you'd better bring your own device! Incoming text photos work fine for those of us using Twigby on iPhones. Otherwise, be prepared for an antiquated photo resolution of 240x180 and file sizes of less than 25 kb (that's right, KILOBYTES). They have obviously set up this model's profile incorrectly on their carrier's network as a feature phone.

Review.Titre: Ive been trying to get my LTE data and…
Review.Contenu: Ive been trying to get my LTE data and mms pics working but my attempts have been unsuccessful. Ive contacted the chat 4 times and no resolve. Can anyone help resolve the issue?

Review.Titre: My wife doesn't have service inside the…
Review.Contenu: My wife doesn't have service inside the grocery store ten miles from us!I keep getting all kinds of garbage from google and others that I hate and don't want!I'm not up on phones and there is very little customer service!I never used data before and this service is telling me I've used a lot for some reason!I think phones are for talking on and computers are for looking things up on!I can't figure what I've used data for unless it's those unwelcome,unwanted messages I keep getting!If that keeps on I'll be changing to another company!

Review.Titre: I like the price of Twigby but I have…
Review.Contenu: I like the price of Twigby but I have to go outside of my home to talk on the phone. I had Verison before and never had to gooutside to talk on the phone. I was paying more for Verison but I thought Twigby used the same towers as Verison.

Review.Titre: Very poorly handled
Review.Contenu: Very poorly handled. Agent wouldn't provide return mailing address, instead and I had to wait for an email that never came until I asked again for it several days later.

Review.Titre: Phone return. I did everything I knew how to do. Including a factory reset and it was still rejected!
Review.Contenu: Phone return I did everything I knew, including a factory reset and it was still rejected!

Review.Titre: I received my SIM card in a damaged…
Review.Contenu: I received my SIM card in a damaged package missing the iPhone SIM card remover tool that was supposed to come with it.

Review.Titre: I like the price but not the quality
Review.Contenu: I like the price but not the quality.  They have told me they don't support 5-digit messaging which is what most companies use for 2-factor authentication.  This causes a huge issue for me as I have several sites which require 2-factor.  Some have the option of text vs a phoe call but some do not.  Sometimes I get the text message but about 50% of the time I do not.Also, there have been times when incoming calls evaporate into cyberspace...the caller thinks my phone is ringing but it's not.  Twice I've worked with tech support on this to temporarily resolve the issue but the bottom line is that there is uncertainty as to whether calls will come in or not.  This problem NEVER happened on this phone before switching from Verizon to Twigby so I know it's not the phone itself.I had high hopes for Twigby but unfortunately I must move on.  I have USMobile on a backup phone and that seems to work fine.  I plan to stop Twigby and get a 2nd line on USMobile, not because I have any hard feelings but rather because I need more reliability.

Review.Titre: Keeps charging me every time talk…
Review.Contenu: Keeps charging me every time talk minutes is exceeded until new unlimited talk plan kicks in.

Review.Titre: A Chat Session Was The FInal Straw
Review.Contenu: The Motorola G7 is listed on Twigby's site as a phone that supports WiFi calling.  Because of that, I bought two Motorola G7 Power phones.  Well, guess what?  WiFi calling didn't work - the phone didn't have the settings shown in the how-to-enable-WiFi-calling article.  So, I had a chat session with one of their tech support folks.  Completely unhelpful - all they wanted to do was argue about my use of the word "incompatible" - they stated (repeatedly) that my phone was NOT incompatible, while also stating that SOME Moto G7 Powers don't have "the right firmware" to support WiFi calling, and basically informing me that I was out of luck.  That's what I call "incompatible", but then again, I only have a Master's degree in Electrical Engineering - what do I know?!?!?p.s. I switched to Republic Wireless, and WiFi calling works great - using the exact same phone.

Review.Titre: no costumer service
Review.Contenu: no costumer serviceneed to dial to Canada only with a calling card

Review.Titre: They had a hard time transferring my number
Review.Contenu: It was impossible to transfer my number effectively from my old carrier. I lost my old number in the process, and though blessing it turned out to be, Twigby was unable to perform its job properly. I give two stars because it could also have been the fault of Mint Mobile, my previous carrier, but I can say that 100% of my experience with Twigby has been sub-optimal. One thing that stood out to me as particularly awful was that they refused to process my refund until I mailed them back- at my expense- the SIM card they sent. Besides this, when I got a refund, they didn't refund all of my purchase.EDIT: Twigby claims they refunded the cost of my SIM card and service, which is probably true. However, when I asked if all of my purchase, including shipping, would be refunded, the representative said yes. Just in case I'm wrong, I challenge Twigby to pull the audio from the call and I will gladly type a retraction. My bank records indicate I paid Twigby $20.84 to expedite me a SIM card that failed to do me any good, that I paid $7.74 for shipping with tracking, and that Twigby refunded me $9.46. A company with integrity would have written off the negligible cost of the SIM card and issued me a full refund rather than blaming the out-transferring carrier and sticking me with the cost.EDIT: Twigby claims that Mint Mobile would not provide a correct account number to allow transfer of my number. While I cannot verify whether it's Twigby who is at fault or Mint Mobile, Mint Mobile repeatedly claimed that they provided the correct information. I challenge the two carriers to duke it out themselves; until then, I'd advise against both of them, but given Twigby's approach to a "refund", I'm inclined to trust their tech savvy less than Mint Mobile's, which at least provided me almost acceptable service for a couple of years.

Review.Titre: 1-2 stars at most …
Review.Contenu: I have zero or barely any speed on your LTE network.

Review.Contenu: Bad signal reception. Easy activation.

Where not able to port my number.

Review.Pseudo: DO NOT VIEW THIS CHANNEL PLEAS

Review.Contenu: Cellular data is bad

Review.Titre: Cheap rates nice.
Review.Contenu: Cheap rates nice.But twigby misrepresented what they sell, unlimited is really 20 gb limit.  When twigby kneecaps your Internet speed for using to much, then you can barely send email. Web sites become unusable.  This they do not state in marketing.  If advertised appropriately,okay. Twigby did not do that.

Review.Titre: Piggybacking Towers Q'able
Review.Contenu: Ive been using Twigby 2 weeks now. Setting my phone up with Twigby was relatively easy for this Luddite who hates tech. I like the cost savings to be sure, but today I noticed I did not get the same amount of bars (0-1) while traveling back roads to our destination that my friend did (full bars). She is on Verizon whose towers Twigby uses. I couldn't get a GPS signal. She could. Hm. That is disappointing. I still only have 2 bars and we are back to town. I'm traveling away from home where the towers may not be as strong, so...time will tell after i get back to the big city.

Review.Titre: Data slow & phone service  bad
Rating
Review.Contenu: Twigby has NOT corrected the issue with their chat after several months that effectively blocks phone number port-in because a ”Google Review” covers the chat window. Twigby has been timely with SIM and that is my only experience so far.

Review.Titre: We were looking forward to the switch
Review.Contenu: We were looking forward to the switch and saving money.  Unfortunately, days after the switch I had horrible reception in my house. I dropped calls, business calls.  Next day everything was fine.  Then, just recently while visiting family almost an hour away, we both had no reception in an area we used to have reception with our previous carrier.  Disappointing….

Review.Titre: I like the service and support, software is underdeveloped
Review.Contenu: I like the service, price and overall setup was easy once I got past the ordering.   I also like that bandwidth is throttled and not autocharged on overuse.  I dislike the ordering process having to validate every phone with a website that is underdeveloped.  Also, there are many restrictions on the app.  I cannot login easily as it keeps dropping my password.  Also most of the time I cannot paste in the field, and the keyboard doesn't show up, so I can't type it either.  Very broken from my experience.  Only the primary account holder can check data usage, quite annoying.  Besides the flaws, overall I am satisfied with the service (product and people), they were helpful and understanding and most of all patient with me even when I was not.

Review.Titre: Have been a customer of Twigby's for…Several years, not exactly sure how many but think around 5 years.
Review.Contenu: Have been a customer of Twigby's for several years. Overall very happy with my experience.  Only one issue, since they switched to Verizon as their carrier my data usage has gone way up, when nothing has changed on my end.  I rarely use data, yet they say I am using 5G rather quickly. So now I can't do much of anything or I go over

Review.Titre: Tried Twigby Verizon Service
Review.Contenu: Tried Twigby to see if their Verizon signal strength would be stronger than the AT&T signal we currently use.  Found it wasn't the day I got the sim card and cancelled the service. Did not get any refund even though I cancelled immediately after I tried service.

Review.Titre: Can I get government WPS on my number?
Review.Contenu: I have the government WPS priority service on my number at Verizon before I ported it.  I was not able to confirm if it will still work or how to add the government program to my number before porting.   In the end the service is fine, but I cannot get WPS.   Twigby did offer to port my number to another provider, but I am electing to stay with them.

Review.Titre: Your complex international call system…
Review.Contenu: Your complex international call system is a joke and it was not properly put forth/published before i sign up with you. That certain countries cannot reach me except on landlines is another unacceptable issue in the year of 2023. hjm

Review.Titre: Instructions on how to transition were…
Review.Contenu: Instructions on how to transition were quite “light.”  Thanks to my brother-in-law for filling in the many blanks.

Review.Titre: Twigby overlooks huge flaws in their flagship devices
Review.Contenu: There is a good value for the service and coverage, while not as good as Verizon's prepaid, is fairly decent. However, their Support and Engineering refuse to review an issue with their best selling phone, the TCL A30 - even after I've brought it up several times and opened tickets about it. All text photos come in extremely low resolution and high compression, usually limiting their file size to less than 100kb. Forget trying to read text in a screenshot someone texts you, or the ability to see any level of detail in a photo you receive by text. It leads me to believe that they set this model up as a "feature phone" on Verizon's network instead of a smartphone. This is a flaw that will likely lead me to cancel service for myself and my family in the near future.

Review.Titre: Where did the data go?
Review.Contenu: I was experiencing slow data downloads for a couple of days. I chatted with your service representative and he said the slowness was due to the fact I had used 1.2 GB of data. I asked him why the app said I still had 192 MB of data left. He told me it takes a couple of hours to update your data usage. I asked him why I went a couple of days before with slow service then. He never answered the question, but did offer me another gigabyte of data for the rest of the cycle. After he gave me that gigabyte of data Yep still said I had 1.112 MB of data. It would be nice to know what happened to the data.

Review.Titre: Beware of NewPhoneMall !!
Review.Contenu: If I had not had to deal with NewPhoneMall I would give Twigby 5 stars . I feel they recommended NewPhoneMall so I knocked off 2 stars. NewPhoneMall is very slow delivering their phones  to start with . The phone I purchased from them was defective. To replace the defective phone from NewPhoneMall would have taken 2 weeks after I paid return shipping . Long story short thankfully I used PayPal to purchase from NewPhoneMall they helped me get a refund. Horrible experience. I did order a new phone from Twigby that experience went smoothly. In the end I did not get the phone I wanted. The Twigby customer service was first class they got me up and running . I went without a phone for 2 weeks so I was not happy about that . Twigby is ok now that I am up and running .

Review.Titre: not a bad service but the intl calls…
Review.Contenu: not a bad service but the intl calls are a bit of a scam u dont get told that you cant call direct its only thru a access number and they limit the amount of numbers u can call

Review.Titre: Mostly good
Review.Contenu: Mostly good, and good in the end.  However, the first attempt at set up left me with outgoing SMS but incoming went to my old phone.  Waited overnight.  Another support chat and that finally got fixed, which in the end I was very grateful for.

Review.Contenu: Communication could have been better. To sign up I used chat and that went well. The Sim card said to go yo the website for directions. Seems to me they could have been included with the card. Then,the website said that you would send and email and tell me when to swap the Sim card. Still haven't got that email. Makes me wonder if I am also missing other information.

Review.Titre: No wifi calling
Review.Contenu: Good network, low prices. Website not intuitive, a little hard to figure out the exact process to sign up. No wifi calling was a deal breaker for me.

Review.Titre: Spotty service
Review.Contenu: Spotty service. Many texts never go through. Probably going to have to suck it up and go back to Verizon. Bummer

Review.Titre: It's great for what it is.
Review.Contenu: You can tell it's just kind of a cheaper alternative. Older phones and not the GREATEST service.  But,  i enjoy it for what it is. I'll continue using it!

Review.Titre: Great prices for monthly phone service
Review.Contenu: Great prices for monthly phone service. 20 GB unlimited data is not adequate for a month if you like to stream movies etc. once used data slows so much you might as well have none.

Review.Titre: Uncertainty regarding Moto G Pure…
Review.Contenu: Uncertainty regarding Moto G Pure phone. Bad connection, intermittent and complete failure of connection, issue are, being addressed by your customer service through manipulation of Wi-Fi and Airplane mode and complete reset of phone. Possible poor quality microphone or poor quality transmission of outgoing voice will be addressed when and if intermittent connection issue is resolved.

Review.Contenu: The service is fine but they don’t offer wifi calling. I wish I knew that ahead of time as I live in a low signal area and my office is in the basement. Now I miss calls

Review.Contenu: Sometimes I have service, sometimes I don't. Sometimes it is very slow. So far, I'm not impressed.

Review.Contenu: After requesting a SIM, I learned that Twigby operates on the Verizon system. I don't get good service from my present T-Mobile carrier, so experimented with another Verizon MVNO. At my location, AT&T has a slight edge on coverage. Twigby won't help me.

Review.Titre: I was thinking with the Verizon…
Review.Contenu: I was thinking with the Verizon platform my audio quality would be superb but I have issues with call quality with my parents in TN and some others saying they cannot hear me.

Review.Titre: Good for simple talk and text, not so much for data.
Review.Contenu: Very low pricing, though phone was a little expensive, for the features you get. Very simple, easy-to-understand: Products, Plans, etc. A little slow on shipping for my taste, and data seems a little un-reachable/usable, when I am inside city limits? Which I don't understand, since this happens, even when I am on a Restaurant's wifi? Other network Carriers, didn't have this problem with my comparably-priced competitor phone(s). I'd say ok for someone needing just bare phone/text, and not reliable data.

Review.Titre: NEED AN INSTRUCTION BOOK ON HOW TO USE…
Review.Contenu: NEED AN INSTRUCTION BOOK ON HOW TO USE THE PHONE.

Review.Contenu: Took almost 72 hours to set up and the connection is occasionally spotty or slow. That said, it works ok and is fine for a low cost service.

Review.Titre: New, but happy
Review.Contenu: I have only had a Twigby account for a month but has been good so far. My sim card was received in just 2 days. Thank you.

Review.Titre: Good online support
Review.Contenu: Good online support.  My phone seems to lose connection with the network fairly often and needs re-booting.  It also seems that you keep raising your prices, so I am not sure how long I will stay after this promotional rate.

Review.Titre: Reality did not meet expectation
Review.Contenu: The screen said to reboot the phone and receive installation info.  I received NOTHING. The phone became functional but I was not even given my number -- that came in an email.  I was left not even knowing anything had happened at all.  Very disappointing.  For me, that was a FAIL. I contacted your chat and got NO HELP.  The chat was worthless.  Your rep just told me "that's the way it is" regardless of what your screen promised.  Booo Twigby.  FAIL. I don't give an even lower rating because the phone does work, after I figured it all out for myself.

Review.Titre: I felt the set up instructions where inadequate.
Review.Contenu: I bought replacement Samsung phone for iPhone 6 that had a failing battery that was overheating within a few minutes of turning the phone on. I felt the instructions for setting up the new Samsung were barely adequate, and left many confusing details for me to figure out. And it was stressful. The iPhone 6 was still active and the texts went to iPhone for one day and did not go to new Samsung purchased to replace iPhone for the SAME phone number.

Review.Titre: Frustrating
Review.Contenu: Yes, TWIGBY has great prices, but I think it really lost something that is vital to a communication company…customer service. I’ve found it extremely frustrating to contact them when there Is no phone number and I can’t “chat” because my problem is I got locked  of the website!

Review.Titre: I got a phone that never did work
Review.Contenu: I got a phone that never did work, spent lots of time with their customer service, still can’t get it to work. Sending it back for my refund. I wasted a lot of my time for nothing & wish I had never tried it. I will stick to Verizon, cheaper is not usually better.

Review.Titre: Never worked for me
Review.Contenu: I could never get this to work with my phone for whatever reason. I'm going to have to cancel. Giving 3 stars because the customer service is good, they really did try to help.

Review.Titre: good phone, terrible getting it authorized
Review.Contenu: I recently got a replacement phone [which is good] and I kept my old phone number. Getting it authenticated was a (totally unnecessary) frustrating, enraging experience.  Twigby put a SIM in the phone - they knew the IMEID, they knew the sim card number.  After hours of annoying wasted time, I found I just needed to supply those numbers WHICH THEY ALREADY KNEW AND SHOULD HAVE JUST FILLED THEM IN.  They would be wise to improve the program - and then they could boast about their simple easy changeover to a replacement phone.

Review.Titre: The Twigby cellular service is mediocre at best.
Review.Contenu: The Twigby cellular service is mediocre at best.  The service is great while I'm at home however as soon as I travel the service is unavailable.  I was only able to receive 2 phone calls after being hospitalized and had to use text messages to communicate.  I will cancel Twigby as soon as my month expires and if you're considering switching to Twigby I strongly suggest you find a different provider.

Review.Titre: Customer service was great when we…
Review.Contenu: Customer service was great when we needed it but the phone service and/or phone isn't behaving like I think it should. Lot's of times where texts & phone calls couldn't go through. This phone is my daughter's. I need to be able to get a hold of her & her I.

Review.Titre: Not having someone to talk to when I…
Review.Contenu: Not having someone to talk to when I got confused was a bit frustrating.  I didn't realize I still had an account with you since I canceled it in 2018. I was looking to get a phone and service for someone else and the computer apparently had me using my account.  Very confusing.

Review.Titre: You can't directly call numbers abroad!
Review.Contenu: I bought the 10G with unlimited calls plan. Their 5G Internet speed is amazing. However, coverage isn't, specially when you need to make our receive a call, but that's almost as good as I had with another service provider. The worst of my experience using Twigby is when calling abroad, there's is no way to dial directly, first you need to dial a number in Texas and then you dial the number you want to call, totally inconvenient.

Review.Titre: High hopes
Review.Contenu: I really like the service overall and appreciate the prices but last month when I went over my internet plan and then called in and paid for more i didn't receive more. I'm out that money and didn't have internet until my new month kicked in. I don't know if this was a mistake or if it is a way to get your money on the back end but it was a great inconvenience for me. If it ever happens again I will just switch back to Verizon and pay the extra money for the flawless service.

Review.Titre: Signing up was not as easy process.
Review.Contenu: Signing up was not as easy process.The flip phone my husband purchased has a minimal 17 page of instructions and unable to get a more complete manual.

Review.Titre: Three cheers for twigby not five.
Review.Contenu: #1Usually, when I have a problem the first thing I do before talking to Twigby is I provide my information that’s necessary and I ask the specific question that I need answered. What happens next as I get a few more questions from customer service that don’t seem to have anything to do with what I’m asking. I get answers they don’t seem to have anything to do with what I’m asking again. Who knows how long this goes on 20 minutes or longer. After getting more and more and more and more specific or just plain, repeating myself, I finally get a straight answer, and then I can get on with my life that’s not a good thing. #2The worst thing is that there’s no Wi-Fi calling. That just doesn’t make any sense to me - I don’t get it.#3 I give ⭐️⭐️⭐️ stars because otherwise it is affordable if you can afford to buy the phone which is possible now thanks to PayPal; thank you for that. #4Thank you for the affordable service despite some frustrations. I’ve been with Twigby since 2019. If I could find a better carrier, I would leave Twigby! I’m still l👀king. 👍👍

Review.Titre: The phone service has been acceptable…
Review.Contenu: The phone service has been acceptable so far.  The phone its' self leaves a lot to be desired.  In an effort to be totally different from other service companies phones they have made it extremely difficult and time consuming to navigate through the options/menu

Review.Titre: I had to enter my IMEI number 9 times…
Review.Contenu: I had to enter my Indian number 9 times before it finally let me off the loop.  I paid for 3-5 day business days shipping, I will be interested to see how long it takes to get here.  Not having a customer service call center is a big point against.

Review.Titre: I lost my phone as was hoping Twigby…
Review.Contenu: I lost my phone as was hoping Twigby could 1) help locate it via GPS, 2) recover my contacts, and 3) burn the phone to make it unusable, but you couldn't do any of that.

Review.Titre: Was better before they went to Verizon…
Review.Contenu: Was better before they went to Verizon now I have a hard time sometimes with signal. Wi-Fi calling would be great if they would offer it. Other than that it's all right.

Review.Titre: Not enough coverage at my home.
Review.Contenu: I thought I would have great coverage with Twigby since they use Verison towers. Sadly I only get one, sometimes two dots of coverage at my house and at the grocery store.

Review.Contenu: I purchased a Moto G phone. I liked the phone, but it's a little bit too technical for me. I will wind up trading it in for a different phone asap.

Review.Contenu: Your info I read said wifi calling is included. After I transferred they told that was your old carrier. I need wifi calling for areas with bad service and when traveling out of country.

Review.Contenu: The price was good, but I was looking for a very simple basic cell phone for my mom who has dementia. Even your "basic" phone is complicated to use!

Review.Contenu: Price is good.  Service is spotty at times

Review.Titre: Pleased with the service, not the shipping speed
Review.Contenu: Switching to Twigby from my previous provider was quick and easy.  Customer service was very helpful when I had a small issue (it was me, not Twigby).  Cell service has been better than what I had, but with no increase in price.  The reason Twigby did not get 5 stars was because of the shipping.  I ordered on a Saturday and paid $18.50 for the fastest shipping.  My SIM card did not arrive until Thursday.  I think it would have arrived the same time if I had chosen the slowest shipping since it was just by USPS and came from TN to SC.  I'm really disappointed I paid the extra shipping fee for no real benefit.  Maybe not specifically Twigby's fault, but they could have been more forthcoming about who they used to provide their shipping.  It may have changed my mind. I was especially desperate because my phone was not working well with my previous provider and I was missing a lot of important texts.UPDATE:  Ordered a SIM card for my son the Saturday after I received mine.  I went with the free shipping and it took only one day longer to arrive than mine did when I paid for fastest shipping.  And that day could be accounted for by the federal holiday on that Monday.  So, do NOT pay for the expedited shipping.  It was a total waste of $18.50.

Review.Contenu: Verizon towers i only got one bar to none, and twigby did not have wifi

Review.Titre: The services can be weak at times and…

Review.Titre: Mixed results with customer service
Review.Contenu: I just started service transition went relatively smoothly.  Detailed instructions need chat.  I have service and voicemail right now.  I gave 3 stars due to 1. A misunderstanding via chat that cost me some $ (Unlike Mint, you cannot insert a trial sim or use your Twigby sim on a trial basis without discontinuing your old service and losing your number.  Must go through full activation and port number.)  2. As a result of #1, I did not receive the full 50% discount promotion I signed up for.  Because I actually transferred my phone number, they will now give me the additional 25% discount on my plan but will not refund proportionate taxes and fees.  That brings me to #3.  Twigby's e.g., $15 plan is nearly $2.50 (in my county) more expensive than my former $15 RedPocket plan because Twigby charges administrative fees that are not specifically disclosed out front and are on top of the usual taxes and fees.  Also, they will refuse to give exact quotes including taxes and fees out front.  Their generic $3.50 quote significantly undershot my actual charges, which significantly overshot taxes and fees for my old plan.  I had to badger a rep to get a real breakdown of my actual statement charges (which is how I know about the admin fees).  I will give them a full trial of at least 6 months, barring other problems, but I am not inclined to do business with a company that is secretive about what they actually charge me.  Also, not refunding my overpaid taxes and fees is, I think, not legal.  I chatted with Scotty and Leah about the tax & fee issue.  Apart from the above, chat service was fast, reasonably polite and responsive.  As usual, you are stuck with the limitations of their training and knowledge and may need to ask the same question multiple times or ask for more detail when they give instructions.  No one offered to connect with a supervisor regarding my issues, so I don't know what would happen if, as with my last service, I am left without service or some other major issue.  We'll see.  Caveat emptor.

Review.Titre: what did you do is the question...
Service is still not as good as Verizon!
Not enough 5G in my area
Took to long to receive SIM card.
Website is nice and simple
Review.Contenu: Website is nice and simple, but we also use Tello and their site is a lot more simple.Coming from Verizon I can say both sites are 10 times more easy to navigate than Verizon

Review.Titre: Almost 100% pleased
Review.Contenu: Your price is fantastic and I shall be recommending Twigby to friends. Your customer service representative I spoke with was so very patient with me helping me eject my old SIM card and inserting the new one. (I’m a senior citizen and very much a non-techie). But I’ve noticed that since switching to Twigby sometime my call gets dropped after being on the phone less than 10 minutes or so. After reconnecting then all is well for the rest of my conversation. Overall very happy I switched,

Review.Titre: Twigby no service clitch?
Review.Contenu: I use Twigby for my mobile service. My husband uses another provider similar to Twigby. We both are on the Verizon network. We live in a rural area in Arizona. One Friday in August my phone experienced a 1-2 hour period of no service while my husband's phone worked flawlessly. Any explanation?Other than that single incident, my service has been fine.

Review.Titre: Customer service was very helpful
Review.Contenu: Customer service was very helpful. Their billing can be wonky when you first start out but it gets worked out if you contact them.

Review.Titre: Customer service is great
Review.Contenu: Customer service is great. I have only had 1 rep that had no idea what was going on or how to solve the issue. All the others are VERY knowledgeable!! Only other is is when you run out of "high speed data" it drops to the speed of old 2g service. Less than 1by1mbps. Can't even track my kids phones on that speed. BUT the unlimited is $35 and gives 20gb of "high speed data" whether your on 4g LTE or 5G. Other than that it works well on Verizon network. If they could just up their "low speed data" to 3g speeds it would be the best and the cheapest (least expensive) on the market.

Review.Titre: Pretty easy to switch services
Review.Contenu: Pretty easy to switch services, & so far coverage area is good.  Only hitch was more from our previous provider who seemed to have trouble porting one prepaid number.  I chose Twigby data plans for each phone that should have been enough for each user based on our usage the previous 3 months, but for some reason on Twigby we ran out of data before the month was up.

Review.Titre: Easy to order, but shipping was delayed
Review.Contenu: Ordering my sim card was very easy and straight forward. However, I paid for express shipping for the sim to arrive in 2-3 days, and it took 7 days to arrive which created some difficult situations.

Review.Titre: I make a couple of calls and texts a…
Review.Contenu: I make a couple of calls and texts a week and needed a reliable and value for money carrier operating on the Verizon network. Twigby fits the bill perfectly. Service since signing up four months ago has been excellent.A point was deducted only because they allocated me an old number belonging to a guy named "Brad" and 99.9% of incoming calls are spam. I'm not paying extra for an app to filter calls, so this has caused me - and continues to cause me - a lot of grief.

Review.Titre: Great Customer Service
Review.Contenu: Great Customer Service  -- chat service works wonderfully  -- Really helpful and waited on chat until port from old company was completed -- and this took approx an hour to do.   Only downside is that they do not offer WiFi calling.  This would help in homes w/o great signal strength.

Review.Titre: How easy it is to transfer to Twigby from your current carrier.
Review.Contenu: The sign-up process for Twigby was straightforward, and Sim card came quickly thru the mail.  I have limited use with the phone as a hot spot (although that is the main reason in choosing Twigby.  Next month we will be taking a long trip and will know how effective the reception will be, and how much data I will use.  If OK, I'll probably post with 5 stars.

Review.Titre: Ordered a replacement phone thru…
Review.Contenu: Ordered a replacement phone thru customer service. Fast and polite to work with.  Phones are reasonably priced, service is reasonably priced and functions same as any other carrier. Very pleased with Twigby! Highly recommend.

Review.Titre: Twigby is a good value…
Review.Contenu: Great price and signal has been excellent. The only hiccup was that for several days, I could not get automated texts. Supposedly, Verizon was blocking the texts until they entered my phone number into their database. ?? It meant I couldn't logon to several accounts that had double verification. Other than that, Twigby has been excellent. The customer service staff dug into the issue I was having, and I received an answer.

Review.Titre: Items received as ordered
Review.Contenu: Items received as ordered.  A little disappointed because delivery was a little slower than hoped after I paid for expedited.Switching carriers to Twigby was a little harder than planned but not real bad.Service is really good and even displays as Verizon.  So far very happy we made the switch!!

Review.Titre: Real Customer Service
Review.Contenu: If it's one lesson in life I've learned, my dad used to say "Get a guarantee". Twigby honored their 30 day guarantee today when I received a refund for the phone I returned. Additionally, their customer service is excellent and has gone above and beyond my expectations. It's always a pleasure to chat with any number of advisors to answer my questions. Everyone has been professional, knowledgeable, friendly, and sometimes showing a good sense of humor. I'm saving $60 bucks a month for 2 lines compared to the big 'V', and the cell phone service is better. No hidden costs or extra charges. I deducted one star because they don't have wifi calling which would be helpful in my rural, mountainous area. But I can live without it. Bottom line...Twigby service is affordable, reliable, accessable, and most importantly hassle free.

Review.Titre: Wi-Fi calling is a must to gain 5 stars
Review.Contenu: Switching to Twigby looked perfect until it wasn't. (We rely on making Wi-Fi calls at home.) Frantically, we texted Twigby to cancel our switch. They made this happen efficiently and with understanding.

Review.Titre: The initial sign up seemed very complicated.
Review.Contenu: The initial sign up seemed very complicated, I had to run through it at least 6 times to complete. The customer service chat people were helpful but still it wasn't easy to do. I am very happy with the actual phone service. Uses Verizon network, reliable and inexpensive.

Review.Titre: Great service overall
Review.Contenu: Great service overall. We get reception mostly everywhere fine. We just don't get service in some buildings in our area. Very important as those buildings include our place of work.

Review.Titre: Everything went well after a small…
Review.Contenu: Everything went well after a small glitch in changing to a new phone. Both lines on account were changed to the new phone type for some reason, shutting down my wife's number until it was corrected.

Review.Titre: low price and good customer service…
Review.Contenu: low price and good customer service through the online chat.  the coverage isn't as good as I hoped, but I think that's because of changes to verizon coverage.

Review.Titre: Service issues
Review.Contenu: I have some difficulty with service in my office. I work in town, in a metal building. Somehow, one side of the building is worse for reception of phone calls. No voices can be heard even when the phone rings. Texting, though does work.

Review.Titre: I really wanted to love it and do love it
Review.Contenu: I really wanted to love it, and for the most part I do!! But I never received the first sim I ordered, I did contact customer support and they were extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and quick. He shipped me another sim and even expedited the shipping for free and it arrived 2 days later. They have an amazing customer support team! However I live in Mississippi and I can make and receive calls and texts, but I cannot use my mobile data too much, it is extremely slow. I imagine it may be because of my location in the country. But I really do recommend them, it's cheap, it works beautifully in the city and even some rural areas. unfortunately I'm having to cancel my Twigby and go with Metro. I still would recommend Twigby to everyone I know!!!!!  I only rated 4 stars only because my mobile data is so slow and laggy, but I believe it's only because of my rural location. Other than that everything is awesome and the customer support team is wonderful, you can tell they care about their customers!!!!

Review.Titre: Chat-only customer service, but low rates
Review.Contenu: As long as you are comfortable with chat-only customer service, Twigby works well. The price is right and it uses the Verizon network, which is the best in my region.

Review.Titre: Great customer service,  but just one thing…
Review.Contenu: Great customer service and so far, the cell service has been just like before when my provider was Verizon. Would have given 5 stars except for process of unlocking my phone with Verizon before transferring my number over to Twigby. I made the mistake of activating and received a porting issue error note. Spent 30+ minutes with Verizon customer service after my account was suspended with them to request my phone be unlocked. They eventually obliged but had to wait awhile. Twigby could help by emphasizing the importance of unlocking your phone with the previous carrier BEFORE trying to activate new service with them. I’m sure I am not the only one who missed this step in the process!

Review.Titre: Great service
Review.Contenu: It’s a great service although there is no service where I live it works all around me. My only gripe, I live on disability and the easy pay plan through pay pal has the payments due too fast. My next is due on January 29th 5 days before I get paid. I’m still trying to figure it out.

Review.Titre: The price is awesome and service good...
Review.Contenu: Update- Travelled from N. Carolina to Wisconsin and never lost service which surprised me.  Very happy with Twigby and the significantly lower price than Verizon.  Thanks so much!  Customer service has been excellent minus the one glitch mentioned below. upgraded rating from 3-4:) What made me bring rating down is that I did not see you all sent me a $20 discount email if I signed up.  I did not see it until right after I signed up and when I chatted to ask if I could still receive it I was told NO.  If you offer it and it is before your first 30 days is up, you should still honor it.  The set up person I chatted with was great and very patient while I talked with Verizon.The last person I chatted with about bad LTE service told me to reboot my phone.  Not quite sure how he thought rebooting my phone was going to keep him in the chat.  Obviously when I rebooted the chat had been dumped. I am still on the fence about keeping service.  I will know in about two weeks.  The trial will be keeping service while on a 17 hour road trip.  Never had a problem on Verizon so we will see

Review.Titre: Terrific service
Review.Contenu: Terrific service. No dropped calls. Always great reception. Price just right. What's not to like!

Review.Titre: We are very thankful that this new…
Review.Contenu: We are very thankful that this new service allows us to have much better coverage than our last service.

Review.Titre: Visual Voicemail doesn't work with Twigby
Review.Contenu: Visual Voicemail doesn't work with Twigby.  You can change that and make it easier for me to get and listen to may voicemails.

Review.Titre: I only gave 4 stars because I am a new…
Review.Contenu: I only gave 4 stars because I am a new customer. So far so good. Anytime I have needed help someone in the chat has helped me . When I set up the phone I had a very patient customer service rep.

Review.Titre: I’m still waiting on a message about a…
Review.Contenu: I’m still waiting on a message about a phone I returned to see how they handled that before I can really say just how good they really are

Review.Titre: Simple account creation
Review.Contenu: Simple account creation.  Pain in process of migration was all induced by the carrier I was leaving.

Review.Titre: I love Twigby
Review.Contenu: I love Twigby, but this last time I went to order a new phone, I found it very difficult.  I had to get on chat several times to work my way through it.  Gave up once and decided to try again the next day.  Used to be so easy.

Review.Contenu: Tyvm!Customer service has been helpful...jus disappointed in coverage at home esp with no wifi calling.

Review.Titre: My experience with Twigby was good
Review.Contenu: My experience with Twigby was good.  I only left because my phone died and I went with a different carrier.

Review.Titre: Pretty good service I have had no…

Review.Titre: Received SIM card finally!
Review.Contenu: I still have not received my SIM card!  I have been waiting 21 days!  I let Twiggy know & another card was sent out November 3rd.  Still waitingUpdate-Finally received SIM card - Kudos to Twigby. However, followed instructions carefully and card would not activate. I was told to reset my phone, which I wouldn’t do. Later got on a chat and got someone who knew immediately what was wrong. She activated the SIM card at her end and the phone number was activated immediately. Great service finally!!!  Thank you!

Review.Titre: Good so far
Review.Contenu: I haven't had Twigby very long. So haven't tested it traveling but it have had no troubles so far.Hopefully they will add Wifi calling and roaming soon.

Review.Titre: It just works
Review.Contenu: It just works. Don't have to worry about anything. So far, I haven't experienced any issues.

Review.Titre: Signup and transfer went smoothly and…
Review.Contenu: Signup and transfer went smoothly and fast. EXCELLENT SERVICE SO FAR!

Review.Titre: Chat in Two
Review.Contenu: Chat people tried to get my two lines working.  One did. The second did not.  After two days, a chat person found a step missing at the Twigby end and I am connected now.

Review.Titre: Newby impressed
Review.Contenu: After a couple of weeks I am impressed with coverage and speed.

Review.Titre: Purchase and setup was fairly smooth…

I've just encountered a strange issue where I can no longer receive SMS notifications from Duo Push, which I contacted Twigby about and have no resolution. I also tried sending an MMS text and it failed. Otherwise, it's been a good experience so far (a few weeks in).

Review.Titre: It is reasonably priced and perfect…
Review.Contenu: It is reasonably priced and perfect plan for my son’s first phone.
